caption.p: Summary of 3 cases series examining the use of convalescent plasma in the setting of SARS-CoV-2.

tr.th: Number of patients (age range in years)
Volume of CP transfused (average day from admission)
Summary of outcomes observed post-transfusion (ratio of patients demonstrating outcome)

tr.td: - qRT-PCR confirmed COVID-19 infection - severe PNA - Pao 2/Fio 2 <300 mmHG - mechanically ventilated
SARS-CoV-2–specific antibody titer > 1:1000 neutralizing antibody titer > 1: 40

-Increase in Pao 2/Fio 2 within 12 days -Decrease in viral loads within 12 days -Increase in SARS-CoV-2–specific and neutralizing antibody titers -Resolution of ARDS within 12 days (4/5) - Mechanical ventilation weaned within 14 days (3/5) -Discharged between days 51-55 (3/5) -Remained mechanically ventilated (2/5)
- qRT-PCR confirmed COVID-19 infection - 2/4 of the following: 1) ≥18 years 2) respiratory distress 3) O 2 saturation <93% at rest 4) Pao 2/Fio 2 <300 mmHg

-Clinical symptoms were significantly within 3 days -Increase in O 2 saturation within 3 days -Trend in increased lymphocyte counts -Trend in decreased C-reactive protein -Imaging showed varying degrees of absorption of lung lesions within 7 days -Undetectable viral load (7/10)
- Confirmed COVID-19 infection (3/4 RT-PCR positive) - Respiratory failure requiring mechanical ventilation (2 required ECMO)
-Negative qRT-PCR -Imaging showed absorption, or partial absorption, of lung lesions -Discharged between days 18-43(3/4) -Remained hospitalized with multiorgan failure (1/4)
